fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira Issue macro in the old editor will fail to render the table on the published page if the displayed fields contains "Parent Link" field, and that field is not populated in any number of issues returned by the JQL query.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Create an issue with the "Parent Link" field empty
 # Step 2: On a Confluence page using the old editor, create Jira issue macro with a JQL that gets the issue created in Step 1 returned as the result.
# Step 3: Set the display mode to "Table" for the macro
# Step 4: Set the "Parent Link" field to be displayed in the macro display options
# Step 5: Publish the page
# Step 6: view the published page

h3. Expected Results
The macro loads the table

h3. Actual Results

Macro does not load the table and instead gives an error

h3. Workaround

Ensure that the "Parent Link" field is supplied for the results of the macro
*Or*
Use the new editor.
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macro Cannot show table with Parent Link field if even a single issue has "non" in that field in the old editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira issue macro does not display values from organizations field(service project) in the table column
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a service project in Jira and [Add an organization to a service project|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-management-cloud/docs/add-an-organization-to-a-service-project/]
 # Ensure the "Organization" field is on the Jira service project's screens
 # Crete some issues in the Jira service project and make sure to fill in the "Organization" field.
 # On a Confluence page, create a Jira-issue-macro with a filter that returns issues from the service project.
 # Select Display Options and insert the Organizations field under Columns to display;

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue macro should be able to show the values from the Organizations field under Columns.
h3. Actual Results
|!image-2021-02-04-01-20-43-112.png|width=313,height=84!|

The Organizations field does not show values in the Jira-Issue-macro output.
  
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira-issue-macro does not display the Organizations field(service project) values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking to view an inline comment low on a page takes me up to an inline comment at the top of the page. I'm unable to interact with the inline comments lower on the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Find a page with multiple inline comments
 # Click through the inline comments down the page

This seems to be additional context:
 * Inline comments are in a table.
 * The page has multiple inline comments
 * The page has multiple inline comments *on different occurrences of _identical_ text.*
 * Example of page in which I encounter this: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CMT/pages/947653022/Theme+and+app+hubs+per+product]
 * I try to click on the comment "Migrate your Atlassian server to cloud" in the cell next to "Administer Jira Cloud products" and get taken up to the similar inline comment in the cell next to "Confluence Cloud." That continues as you go down the page.
 * *Screen capture video of bug:* [https://www.loom.com/share/98dc54b98107425ea0e9f80ceb07b129]

h3. Expected Results

When I click an inline comment, it will open the comment I'm clicking on.
h3. Actual Results

Occasionally, an inline comment higher on the page will open and I'm unable to see the comment I'm trying to see.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking to view an inline comment low on a page takes me up to an inline comment at the top of the page

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, anonymous user will see the welcome tour message for each page they visit. 

It will be nice if the welcome tour for anonymous user only shown for one page instead repeating the same message on all the pages they access.

Decision report macro doesn't keep a sorting format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's possible to use the Jira Issue Macro to pull information from Jira. However, in case the macro is configured to display the Team or the Parent Link fields, and one of the issues pulled doesn't have them filed (the field is blank), the macro won't work. The macro will be greyed out, and the below message will be displayed: 

*(!) Refresh didn't work. Try again or click an issue to see it in JIRA.*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Add the Jira Issue macro on it.
 # Configure the macro to display the *Team* or the *Parent Link* fields.
 # Make sure that one of the pulled issues doesn't have one of these fields filled.

h3. Expected Results

The macro should load properly.
h3. Actual Results

The macro doesn't load:

!image-2021-02-02-09-35-30-443.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: [REGRESSION] Jira Issue Macro is not working in case the Team or Parent Link fields are added to the macro and are not filled in one of the issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a new Team Calendars macro, searching for a calendar won't prioritize the exact match, which makes it difficult to find the desired calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a high number of calendars with similar names but slightly differences
# Insert a new Team Calendars macro and try to search for one of those calendars, using its exact name

h3. Expected Results
The search should prioritize calendars with the exact name

h3. Actual Results
Calendars with some of the words being searched are listed first and sometimes, depending on the number of calendars the instance has, the exact match is not even listed.
[^calendar_search.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Search for a unique word instead of the calendar's full name.
fields.summary: Calendar macro doesn't prioritize exact matches when searching for calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sharing a page with another user, on the field "Send a notification" to search for a user, when you select one, their avatar are displayed with a large size, which is an issue when sharing the page, as the *Share* button becomes unavailable. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Click on the button 'Share'
 # Search for a user and select the user name


h3. Expected Results
The avatar is shown on the small size as expected and we can see the share button

h3. Actual Results
The avatar is loaded way too big and the share button disappears.


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sharing page is not rendering the user avatar properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a site-admin impersonates a user and then clicks on *switch back* to stop impersonating the user, if you click on browser's back button, the pop-up will keep appearing and the *switch back* link will not do anything
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Impersonate a user
 # A pop-up will appear to switch back to your user. Click on *switch back*
 # When you're redirected to User Management page, click on *browser's back button*

h3. Expected Results

The site-admin user should not see the switch back pop-up.
h3. Actual Results

The switch back pop-up will keep appearing even if you close the window.

 

Note: Some users reported that they were also able to reproduce this issue in a bit different way:
 # Impersonate a user
 # A pop-up will appear to switch back to your user. Click on *switch back*
 # Close the browser
 # Open it again, and access the Instance. You will be logged with the original account, but the pop up will still appear, and the *switch back* link will not do anything

h3. Workaround

A manual workaround is to have the admin to navigate to {{<siteurl>/impersonate}}, which will reset the impersonate function. e.g. [acme.atlassian.net/impersonate|http://acme.atlassian.net/impersonate]
fields.summary: After impersonating a user, the "switch back" pop-up can still appear

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently, the space shortcuts in Confluence spaces can be configured by administrators or Space admins only. This may cause inconvenience to the users who want to configure their own space shortcuts.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Navigate to the sidebar of any Confluence space.
2) You will not be able to add or edit a Space shortcut unless you are the Confluence administrator or Space admin.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide ability so that users can configure their own space shortcuts.
fields.summary: Provide facility so that users can configure their own space shortcuts.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the [Table of contents|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/] (TOC) in the legacy editor, the generated links will render with the same formatting applied to the page headings.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page with the Legacy editor template.
 # In this page, add some headers and apply formatting to it (e.g. colors, strikethrough, superscript).
 # Add the Table of contents macro and publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

The links generated by the macro should not render the formatting applied to the headings.
h3. Actual Results

The links will use the same style applied to the headings:

*Flat style*:
 !flat.png|thumbnail!

*List style*:
 !list.png|thumbnail!

(i) Additional notes:
 * This does not happen with the current editor.
 * If you copy and paste the headings from external sources that will allow the font size to be configured, the links will render the same size.

h3. Workaround

Besides [converting the page to the current editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/convert-pages-to-the-new-editor/], you can:
 * Use the *Clear formatting* button from the formatting options.
 * Manually re-apply the heading without any colors or formatting.
fields.summary: Links from the Table of contents macro render heading formatting in the Legacy editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Jira, the [+Get application role+|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-application-roles/#api-rest-api-3-applicationrole-get] API is available for fetching various information on application access:

* applicationkey
* numberOfSeats
* remainingSeats
* userCount
* hasUnlimitedSeats

h3. Proposed solution

This API should also be available for Confluence to get this data. There is no such thing currently available for Confluence meaning that you can only get the *remainingSeats* count for Jira alone which is inconsistent data when you have to take all products into account.
fields.summary: Add REST API endpoint for application roles

fields.description:
Hi all! 

*Background:* 

My company has cohorts of users and developers. Developers use Jira to track work, and Jira serviceDesk to track user requests. Developers have Jira licenses and users do not, they are customers of Jira ServiceDesk.

We would like to use confluence, and the Jira issues macro, to display to users the ServiceDesk tickets that are currently being worked on. 

*Problem:* 

Right now, the Jira issues macro only links to *Jira* views of each ticket. Users who click on these links are unable to view the ticket. As customers, they can only see the serviceDesk portal version of each ticket.

*Need:* 

An optional setting in the Jira Issue macro that causes ticket in serviceDesk projects to link to the serviceDesk portal version of each ticket. This would allow users to see the content of each ticket.
fields.summary: JIRA Issue macro: add option to direct serviceDesk links to the ticket's customer view

fields.description: We have had several hots due to "run away workers" processing events after actions like large page moves, page deletes, or permissions changes. Now that the index nodes are tuned correctly, it's not such a problem, but we should look for improvements for these operations that cause a lot of indexing, and also see if there are any ways to lessen the impact of one tenant on others (delayed indexing)
fields.summary: investigate bulk indexing events for potential improvements.

fields.description:
Our team works in a regulated field and the current versioning scheme in confluence is not sufficient as you lose the ability to track the state of pages at the time of release of a product. Once work begins on the next version of the product all the pages continue to version independently and makes it hard to establish the space state at the time of previous releases. Additionally, the ability to do post-release edits to documentation is import to revise any documentation errors that might be uncovered after release. Currently, the releases documentation is locked into the page history and buried under any more recent development.

 

The only workaround I have found is copying a whole space for each release version.
fields.summary: Enable page versioning as availible in scroll versions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In TOC macro when exclude heading used, it does not show the TOC intermittently.
- https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-table-of-contents-macro/
 !image-2021-01-29-16-39-10-495.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add any dummy text with headings on page

 # In TOC edit mode add headings that need to be excluded using the above format 
for eg a.*|b.*|c.*|d.*
 !image-2021-01-29-16-41-31-428.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
It should exclude the headings in TOC and show the rest of the headings on the TOC macro

h3. Actual Results
It breaks the macro and does not show anything.

*Note*: Preview shows fine but once the page published the TOC will not appear.

h3. Workaround
In some cases adding the heading directly helps. for eg 
 !image-2021-01-29-16-44-58-162.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-01-29-16-45-21-401.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-01-29-16-46-16-241.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-01-29-16-46-33-033.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently 'Google Drive for Confluence' macro in a Confluence page displays the embedded documents as per the actual permissions for the document in Google drive. So even if the Confluence page is in view mode, the embedded document will be editable if the user has edit permissions to the document. This may result in the user accidentally making modifications in the Google document in the page view mode.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Create a document in Google drive with edit permission.
 2) Create a new Confluence page and embed the Google doc using the 'Google Drive for Confluence' macro.
 3) The Google document will be editable in the view mode of the Confluence page.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide configuration such that Google document is always noneditable in view mode.
fields.summary: Provide facility so that the document embedded using  'Google Drive for Confluence' macro is always non editable in the view mode.

But in Jira macro when i click the create issue page,  i only see components and i can't fill epic link field. So that's why i can't create issues. Can you help me or support me in this case?
fields.summary: Can't create issue in Confluence because of Epic Link mandatory field in Jira side

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JavaScript API is not working in a particular page that can be created by loading the attached space export.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to a Confluence Cloud site.
 # Install the app "Table Filter and Charts for Confluence"
 # Visit the Import a "Confluence space admin UI": [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/importspace/importconfluencespace.action.]
 # After being taken to the Jira Macro Repair page ([https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/jim-validator/view.action]), click the "Start" button.
 # Navigate to the imported space: [https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~409074547/overview]
 # Navigate to the page titled "Copy of Copy of [obfuscated] - November 2020 - Monthly report"
 # Open the browser's dev tools.
 # In the console tab of the dev tools, select the app iframe {"extension_id": "com.stiltsoft.confluence.plugin...table-filter.stiltsoft.com".
 # Enter AP.user.getLocale(console.log);
 # Enter AP.context.getContext(console.log);

h3. Expected Results

At step 9, a locale is logged in the console.

At step 10, the context is logged in the console.
h3. Actual Results

At step 9, a locale is not logged in the console.

At step 10, the context is not logged in the console.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: JavaScript API is not working in a particular page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

URLs defended using Proofpoint URL Defense software for email don't paste into Confluence Cloud pages properly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy a URL that has been defended using the Proofpoint URL defense via Outlook email platform. 
 # Paste in to an Confluence page, Legacy or Fabric Editor. 
 # Note that the full URL is not pasted, dropping all content after instance of a double semicolon ";;"

h3. Expected Results

Full URL should be pasted into Confluence page, essentially making the copy/paste process unaffected. 
h3. Actual Results

Proofpoint URLs that contain a double semicolon
{code:java}
;;{code}
drop after first semi-colon, breaking URL altogether. 
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: URLs defended using Proofpoint don't paste into Confluence Cloud pages properly
Changes made to a draft with REST API won't take effect on the editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We've identified that, some particular steps taken into Confluence may trigger some events in the back-end that will result in incorrect pages showing on the feed (pages that weren't updated).

This issue pollutes the new feed with updates that never happened.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Our developers were able to reproduce this issue with the following steps:
 # Create a new page
 # Add the created page link into another blog. Close the page but don't publish the changes
 # Update the title of the linked page and publish (created in step 1)

h3. Expected Results

Feed shows real updates.
h3. Actual Results

Feed shows updates which are neither in the page history or unpublished draft.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence sends invalid Streamhub messages, causing incorrect pages to be listed on the Recents list

fields.description:

The code would then show up in the code snippet, syntax highlighted based on the file type, line numbers from the file, and there would be a link to go to the source file at the line clicked.
fields.summary: Code snippet shows code from bitbucket

fields.description:
Code snippets (created with the triple back quotes) cannot be collapsed. This often interferes with readability and this was possible in Confluence a couple of years ago.

I'd like to put in feature request for code snippets to be collapsible, in a page and inside a table in a page, and inside an expandable block.

Even better, support additional settings on a code snippet in the editor. Currently in the editor, when click inside a code snippet the 3 operations supported are:
 * choose programming language,
 * copy the code (very handy), and
 * delete.

In addition, it would be nice to
 * indicate a subset of lines of code to show while collapsed, this would default to "all lines". Whereas if you indicate first and last line, then while collapsed it shows only those lines; while expanded it, it shows all. This allows you to focus the code block on the most important code, while user can get more context if needed.
 * max out the number of lines to something reasonable, like 50; beyond that, scrollbar must be used
 * enable/disable line numbers
fields.summary: Collapsible code snippets

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, when user create a new space the blog option will be included on the space.

It will be good to have feature to disable the blog option when creating a new space.
fields.summary: Disable blog option when creating a new space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Notifications API|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/app-migration/rest/api-group-notification-api/#api-webhook-put] allows for registering webhooks by making a {{PUT}} request on {{/migration/webhook}}. When this endpoint is called immediately after the Connect install event, authentication fails with either HTTP status {{400}} or {{403}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Build a Connect App that:
 # Accepts an install event
 # Then immediately attempts to {{PUT /migration/webhook}}

h3. Expected Results

{{200}} response indicating a successful webhook registration

h3. Actual Results

{{400}} or {{403}} response indicating failure, depending on network timing

h3. Workaround

Because this seems to be an asynchronous timing issue, apps can introduce an artificial pause.

This workaround makes the issue a P3 according to [ecosystem severity|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DEVHELP/pages/311099409/Severity+Level]. However, the unpredictable nature of such timing bugs is likely to lead to developer frustration and additional developer support requests, for Server to Cloud app migrations.
fields.summary: Notification API fails when called immediately after Connect install event

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sharing a page using the Public Links feature, the attachments don't load and the following error is displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-27 at 18.31.41.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(!) In order to reproduce this bug, you need to have Public Links enabled in your instance. 
# Create a page.
# Add an attachment to the page.
# Click on *share* and turn on Public Link for this page.
# Open the generated link using the Incognito window.

h3. Expected Results
The attachments should be displayed on the public link.
h3. Actual Results

On each attachment, we see the *Failed to load* error message.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Public Links feature fails to load attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Importing an XML backup from Confluence Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a XML site export from Confluence 5.10 or above
# Go to the admin *Site import* section
# Run the import

This has been tested with Confluence 7.10.0, 7.6.2, and 7.2

h3. Expected Results
Import completes as expected, since this version is above 5.10. 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Cloud instance logs:
{noformat}
We can't import your file because it's from an old server version. Please upgrade to Confluence server 5.10 or later, and then use the Cloud Migration Assistant for Confluence to migrate your spaces.
{noformat}

h3. Notes

With versions above 7.10, the following error is seen:
{noformat}
Tried to import a full-site backup with build number 8506. Confluence (build number = 6452) will only accept site imports >= 3047 until current.
{noformat}

Although the error is misleading, any site import will fail even if a previous or newer version is used. 

h3. Workaround

Use the Cloud Migration assistant, or use the space import feature.
fields.summary: Importing an XML backup from Confluence server fails with version error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira link is shown on all pages though it's not linked to the Jira issue
When you link a confluence page on the Jira issue, on the Confluence end, it shows on all the pages however Jira linked to only on-page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira, select a project and create an issue.
 # Click on the linked page and you will see the Jira issue linked on (top of the page next to the title)
 # Navigate to all pages one by one, you see that same is being reflected on all the pages.

(i) Another way to reproduce the issue 

# Add a Jira issue link on a Confluence page.
# After a second or two you will see that the Jira issue link is been displayed on all the pages in space.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the Jira link on only one confluence page where the Jira issue is linked.

h3. Actual Results
# Jira issue shows on all the pages, however, the issue is not linked.
# Sometimes it shows zero links with the below error on all pages
{code}
Jira links cannot be displayed. Either you do not have correct Jira permissions or the links have been removed.
{code}

(!) *Notes*:

# No permissions issue observed here due to which the link is displayed on all the pages on the space.
# Refresh app link does not help to fix the issue.
# Content indexing post removing all the Confluence pages linked to the Jira issue did not help.
# Jira macro repair did not help too.
# Could reproduce this issue in two instances hence creating this bug,


h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira links are shown on all Confluence pages though its not linked to the Jira issue

fields.description:
Pages in Confluence Cloud normally show the content id of the page in the URL.
Although this can be useful for administration, programming, and ensuring that the correct page is being referenced, this can also be problematic for users migrating from server, and is not as aesthetically pleasing. There are also benefits when referring to pages from external sources using a link that does not rely on the page id.

For this, I would like to suggest the following page URL format be supported as an option:
For this page URL
- https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JRAD/pages/98305/Jared
Support This URL as well:
- https://jaredlongtest02.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JRAD/pages/Jared

This would make it possible to refer to pages by title (which are uniquely identifiable by their name in a given space as of this writing).
fields.summary: Page URLs should be able to be configured to not show the content id of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Confluence Analytics tool, if you count the total number of views that are reported for a given time period, and then count the number of views for that same period of time but requested in sections, the total number of views will not be equal.

For example, if you view the analytics for views in a space for both the months of November to December, then you look at the views for November by itself, and December by itself, the report of both months will contain *less* total views in the report, than the report for the individual months.

This is also true for shorter time periods. like a 2-day period chunked into two single-day periods for comparison.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Step 1: In a space that is regularly viewed and contains a good number of days with non-zero views, observe the page analytics for a given space over a period of time. You can make counting easier by exporting to CSV and then using a spreadsheet program to sum the views for the whole period.
 - Step 2: Export or observe the results for the same period of time, but request the period in chunks. Count the sum of views among all the collected chunks, and then compare that to the export or data from the long period export.

h3. Expected Results

The total views for the given period will sum to the same value as those views collected in smaller segments.

h3. Actual Results

The longer period will contain a smaller number of total views.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: View counts in Confluence Analytics for a given period of time differ based on the length of the segments in which they are viewed
Generic message when a page already has the same title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The [Labels list|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-labels-list-macro/] is used to report pages using labels on a space. However, this macro is not working for Unlicensed users - they are prompted with an error message: You've reached a restricted page.

When they click a label they get this error message and no page is displayed, even though the pages do not have restrictions set to them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence Space, and link it as a Knowledge Base for a Jira Service Desk project.
 # On JSD, make sure that *Any active user* is able to access the Space.
 # Create a page on this Space.
# Create a new page and add a lable to it (e.g. test)
 # Add a *Labels list* macro on it.
 # Access this page, as a Service Desk customer (Unlicensed user) > click on the label test;

h3. Expected Results

The macro should work properly, redirecting the user to all pages using that label on this specific space 
h3. Actual Results
When the user clicks on a label they get this error message and no page is displayed to them, even when pages have no restrictions: 
*You've stumbled on a restricted page*

 !Screen Shot 2021-01-25 at 16.46.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Labels list macro is not working for Unlicensed users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to install an add-on on a large Instance (with more than 8000 Spaces), the installation will thrown an error on the UI. Even though the installation is still happening in the back-end and may succeed, there's no way for the end user to follow up on the installation progress on the app.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Instance with a huge amount of Spaces (more than 8000, at least).
 # Try to install an add-on.
 # Follow up the progress on the UI.

h3. Expected Results

The add-on should show as installing until the end of the installation.
h3. Actual Results

Below error is thrown on the UI:

!image-2021-01-25-14-39-49-442.png|width=569,height=161!

Once the installation fails, below error is displayed on the *Manage Apps* section, while the installation is still ongoing (the date will vary according to desired day):

!image-2021-01-25-14-43-52-222.png|width=716,height=83!
h3. Workaround

(on) The installation may succeed in the back-end after a couple of hours. If the error on the *Manage Apps* disappears and the add-on wasn't installed, please, reach to our Support.
fields.summary: Installing an add-on on a large Instance will thrown an error on the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the past week on Hello, there have been 8 move page failures. All failures have the same error message:
{code:java}
GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status: 404  {code}
I tried to investigate this with the cc-graphql team, and we suspect it's presumably due to 404 being returned from a downstream service used by the following endpoint:
{code:java}
wiki/rest/api/content/{pageId}/move/append/{parentId} {code}
([See this slack thread|[https://atlassian.slack.com/archives/CFHC8B9U2/p1611089985033800])]
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unknown
h3. Expected Results

Move page action is successful
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status: 404
{noformat}
Here is the Splunk query which can be used to get a list of failures and corresponding traceIds. 
{code:java}
eventtype="micros_analytics-service"
ext.event.tenantId="*"
m.t=application
ext.event.product=confluence
ext.event.env="prod"
ext.event.eventName="ui unhandledError"
ext.event.attributes.error="*404*" ext.event.attributes.componentStack!="*PageTree*"
AND (ext.event.attributes.operationName="MovePageAppendMutation" OR ext.event.attributes.operationName="MovePageAfterMutation")
  | table ext.event.attributes.operationName, ext.event.attributes.traceId, ext.event.attributes.error, ext.event.timestamp, ext.event.tenantId{code}
h3. Workaround

Unknown
fields.summary: Moving a page with the new dialog occasionally results in a 404

fields.description:
Please provide an option, at least at user level and preferably even globally by the admin, to disable automatic conversion of characters to emoticons.

A character like ":" is all but uncommon to use in text and every time one has to act to prevent it from being converted to a smiley.

There's too much risk that emoticons are being added by accident now.

The justification that "the majority of customers want Emoticons" is almost ridiculous if you want to consider Confluence to be a professional product used for professional purposes.

There is a demand as already shown by CONFCLOUD-38234, CONFCLOUD-30867 and CONFCLOUD-4884.
fields.summary: Disable automatic emoticons insertion

fields.description:
*Description:-*

Currently, when you do a text-based search in CQL it provides a response in the descending order of the page id. Also, we can sort the results by title, created date, and updated date. However, in the UI, the sort order is different for the same search since it does a relevance-based search. This may cause inconvenience to a user who wants the UI and CQL results to be identical.

*Steps to replicate:-*

1) Create a couple of pages in multiple spaces with keywords like 'mobile' and 'mobile device'.
 2) Search for 'mobile device' in the UI. The UI gives relevant based search.
 3) Execute [https://xxx.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=] text~" mobile device" in Curl or Postman tool.
 4) The results and the sort order is different in both cases.

*Suggested resolution:-*

Provide facility in CQL to provide relevance-based search as in UI.
fields.summary: Ability in CQL/REST API to provide relevance based search

fields.description:
I'm building a documentation space for internal use at my organization. By default, only Confluence admins can change page restrictions, but that gets tedious when several system administrators are making pages that need different restrictions for their teams. When I give a user the ability to change restrictions, they can change restrictions on all pages. There is no middle ground for restriction settings.

What would help is the ability to permit page creators to change restrictions on pages they create and child pages under those pages. These user-imposed restrictions could be overridden by a space admin as need be. The ability for a user to change restrictions on pages they've created could be added/removed by a space admin via permissions, and it might even be controlled on a page-by-page basis if needed. The default permission would be what it is currently: users lacking permissions to change restrictions. Like the "Delete Own" permission, it could be the "Restrict Own" permission.

I'm not sure what the perfect implementation would look like, but these are the thoughts I have. (Repost: accidentally posted in Server/Data Center)
fields.summary: Fine User control over Page Restrictions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a Confluence administrator, you can upload an image to become the site favicon through the [Site Logo and Favicon option|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/change-your-site-logo-and-colors-873871359.html].

While trying to upload an image that has been manually converted from the following specific formats as the site's favicon, an error will be displayed:

!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

(i) The affected image must be a .ico one or go through a modification tied to the .ico extension. Images converted from other formats won't face the issue. For example:

{quote}
* .ico to .jpg
* .ico to .png
* .png to .ico
* .jpg to .ico
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Manually edit an image file's extension from .ico to another format or vice-versa (by editing its extension).
# Save the image locally.
# As an administrator of Confluence, tap the cog icon at the top right.
# Select *Site log and favicon* from the sidebar
# Upload the converted image.

h3. Expected Results
The image should be uploaded as the new site favicon.

h3. Actual Results
The following error is displayed:

{quote}
*The following error(s) occurred:*

The image that you uploaded appears to be corrupt. Please try again, or try another image file.
{quote}

h3. Workaround
* Upload the original image without converting it.
* Use a favicon converter tool (I.E. https://favicon.io/favicon-converter/)
fields.summary: Uploading manually converted .ico favicon results in an error

Hi,

     confluenceVersion: 1000.0.0-59e0e330b08d

     referer: https://factioninc.atlassian.net/
     traceId: 3db6846778086e39
     url: /wiki/pages/templates2/listpagetemplates.action
     userName: anonymous{code}

 * Manually accessing the other features of the space works fine:
 ** *Reorder Pages*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/reorderpages.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *Orphaned Pages*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/listorphanedpages.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *Undefined Pages*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/listundefinedpages.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *Attachments*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/listattachmentsforspace.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *Trash*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewtrash.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *Export*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/exportspacewelcome.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
 ** *RSS Feeds*: https://<SITENAME>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/listrssfeeds.action?key=<SPACEKEY>

h3. Workaround

Reach out to [Atlassian Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact], mention this bug request to them and ask them to deactivate the feature flag that cause this error.
fields.summary: Accessing Content Tools on random spaces throws an error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, if a user creates a new Event type in Team Calendars and switch to the Timeline view, the "Who" field value is not displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new event type
 # Create a new event of the type that was just created
 # Add someone to the  "Who" field
 # Save the event

h3. Expected Results

The value under the "Who" field displays is all views.

!Screen Shot 2021-01-14 at 08.14.53.png|width=212,height=130!

!Screen Shot 2021-01-14 at 08.15.00.png|width=210,height=131!

!Screen Shot 2021-01-14 at 08.15.07.png|width=223,height=129!

 
h3. Actual Results

The value of the "Who" field is present in all views except "Timeline"

!Screen Shot 2021-01-14 at 08.15.13.png|width=242,height=135!
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

 

Notes: There are no mentions of this behavior on the feature documentation:

 [Add and Delete Custom Event types|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-and-delete-custom-event-types/]
fields.summary: Switching to Timeline view on Team Calendars results in the Who field value not being displayed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Attachments can have special characters like the one below in their file name.
** https://util.unicode.org/UnicodeJsps/character.jsp?a=2028
* And when uploaded, and added to a page, it appears fine, but publishing it causes the page to break and cannot be loaded or edited again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page, and upload this images in the zip file below.
**  [^Files.zip] 
# Both image can be uploaded and will appear fine in preview.
# Publish the page, and the page will not load with this error message.
** {code:java}We couldn't display your content{code}
# For the image without the unicode, the storage format will show that the image is linked correctly.
** {code:java}<ac:image ac:align="center" ac:layout="center" ac:original-height="800" ac:original-width="1280">
    <ri:attachment ri:filename="Name.png" ri:version-at-save="1" />
</ac:image>{code}
# For the image with the unicode, the link to the file is broken, causing the issue.
** {code:java}<ac:image ac:align="center" ac:layout="center" ac:original-height="800" ac:original-width="1280">
    <ri:attachment ri:version-at-save="2" />
</ac:image>{code}
# It appears that the unicode caused the link to the image to not be generated.

h3. Expected Results
* Either,
## The attachment should fail to be uploaded, with a user friendly error message.
## Or if we want to upload there types of files, the link to the attachment should be generated, and displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
* Attachment uploads sucessfully, but not linked, causing the page to not load any content and becomes uneditable. 

h3. Workaround
* Use a Unicode detector to find and remove the special character, and reupload the attachment.
* Content needs to be edited via source or Rest API.
fields.summary: Attachments with blank unicode can be uploaded and causes page to break

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Start parameter isn't working when using the [GET /wiki/rest/api/content/\{id}/child/\{type}|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-content---children-and-descendants/#api-api-content-id-child-type-get] API with Custom Types.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new cloud app that introduces its own custom content type

 # Create two custom content items as children of a page

 # Request those custom content items through the content child API. Set the start query parameter to *0* and the limit query parameter to *1*: _GET /content/<id>/child/<custom-content-type>/?start=0&limit=1_

 # Do the same request again, this time set start to *1*: _GET /content/<id>/child/<custom-content-type>/?start=1&limit=1_

 # Do the same request again, this time set start to *2*: _GET /content/<id>/child/<custom-content-type>/?start=2&limit=1_

h3. Expected Results

Get two different responses from items 4 and 5.
h3. Actual Results

The start parameter is ignored and we receive the same response from items 4 and 5.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: GET /wiki/rest/api/content/{id}/child/{type} start parameter isn't working with custom types

Customers should get a warning to backup Confluence when deleting the site.

Reason: At times a customer forgets to generate a site backup and it causes data loss.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users don't have a way to navigate back from the View Source Page.

 If you go to the "..." menu and select "View Source" you get taken a page from which there is no way to navigate out except using the browser's back button. This used to open in a popup before but now navigates the current browser window away from your page. A user would expect it to have the chrome around it so they can still navigate, or else it should open in a popup/dialog.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # go to the "..." menu
 # select "View Source"

h3. Expected Results



Have a way to navigate back from the view source page.
h3. Actual Results

!Screen Shot 2020-06-24 at 11.43.31.png!
h3. Workaround

Users need to use the Browser's back (<-) button to go back from the view source page.
fields.summary: No way to return to Confluence from view source page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - After inserting a new lane, you won't be able to rename the lane right away. You can access the edit screen but it won't' allow you to edit it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5.  
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Add a Lane

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Anonymous users are not able to save inline comments on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that anonymous users have *Add* permission to *Comments* on the space.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence Cloud, it's possible to use the [Content by Label macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-content-by-label-macro/] to pull report of pages that contain the desired label(s). That said, it's common to create a Report page, having some Content by Label macros pulling pages from different labels, to easily organise content so end users can navigate on the Instance. However, pages with a high amount of Content by Label macros won't behave as expected. Some of the macros may fail to load, intermittently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure to have an Instance with 200 pages, labeled with 200 different labels.
 # Create a page.
 # Add 200 content by label macros, each one searching for a different label.
 # Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results

All the macros should pull the pages that have the specified label.
h3. Actual Results

Some macros may eventually fail to load, with two possible error messages:

*Failed to get macro details*

*!image-2021-01-12-12-13-13-016.png|width=303,height=44!*

Or, below error message:
{code:java}
Error rendering macro 'contentbylabel' : CQL was parsed but the search manager was unable to execute the search. CQL: 'label = "<LABEL-NAME>"'. Error message: java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: Task java.util.concurrent.FutureTask@<ID>[Not completed, task = java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter@5aea19aa[Wrapped task = null]] rejected from java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor@<ID>[Running, pool size = 10, active threads = 10, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = <N>]{code}
(on) *<LABEL-NAME>*, *<ID>* and *<N>* will vary on the message, according to the Instance details/macro configuration.

On the browser console, below error is thrown:
{code}Uncaught (in promise) Error: GraphQL error: Exception querying the remote GraphQL service: io.atlassian.platform.micros.asynchttp.UnexpectedHttpStatusResponseException: Unexpected status code 500
    at new t (confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2)
    at confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2
    at confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2
    at Set.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2
    at Map.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at e.broadcastQueries (confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2)
    at confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2
    at Object.next (confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2)
    at b (confluence-v1.prod.atl-paas.net/master/vendors~4134d62c.MLUonLJw2g.js:2){code}
h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page may work, as the issue is intermittent. In case it gets more frequent, the best solution would be to split the page's content into smaller pages.
fields.summary: Pages with more than 200 Content by Label macros will fail intermittently to load the macro results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The problem is with multiple pages. For example, page ID 234490087.

All the pages within the search criteria.

Some pages missing.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
Currently, while using wildcard search in confluence using double quotes and wildcard together displays 0 search results.

The steps:
 Step 1: A search for arbejde gives 18 results
 Step 2: A phrase search for "arbejde" gives 18 results
 Step 3: A search for a*beside gives 18 results

All of the above works fine as expected.
 However,

 It would great if the double quotes search results are reliable even while using a wildcard in the search parameter.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Confluence search API is not providing excerpt highlight in body or title when performing an exact phrase search containing multiple words.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Scenario 1:-*

1) Create a Confluence page containing a single word say "mobile".

2) Perform a browser CQL Search for this single word.

https://atlassiantester5.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=((title%20~%20%22mobile%22)%20OR%20(text%20~%20%22mobile%22))%20AND%20space%20IN%20(CHEM)&expand=content.history.lastUpdated&limit=20

The JSON response excerpt tag will contain below data

hl@@@mobile@@@endhl

*Scenario 2:-*

1) Create a Confluence page containing a phrase say "mobile device".

2) Perform a browser CQL Search for the exact phrase.

[https://xxxxx.atlassian.net/wiki/rest/api/search?cql=((title%20~%20%22%5C%22mobile%20device%5C%22%22)%20OR%20(text%20~%20%22%5C%22mobile%20device%5C%22%22))]

The JSON response excerpt tag will not highlight the search keywords.
h3. Expected Results

The Confluence search API should highlight the keyword in the title or body irrespective of the type of search.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence search API does not highlight when performing an exact phrase search containing multiple words.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence search API is not providing excerpt highlight in page body or title when performing an exact phrase search containing multiple words.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When performing a space export, we expect to only export the contents of a single space.

In certain situations where the database is corrupted in subtle ways, we will sometimes get multiple spaces exported.

The symptom is that the entities.xml file contained in the export will contain more than one space. Searching for object class="Space" will return more than one result.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a space
 # Import to confluence server

h3. Expected Results

Only 1 space get imported to Confluence server


h3. Actual Results

2 space get imported to confluence server

h3. Workaround

As for the workaround on this one, on past cases, it was possible to import the space export without any issues after modifying and editing the entities.xml file of the space export that you are trying to import.

If you open the archive and look at the .xml, there is a part where it references two spaces, you can see by searching with:
{code:java}
object class="Space" {code}
The workaround consists in deleting the object class = "Space" that is referencing to the space, and all the content within the object (basically starts on the object class= "space" and delete everything, including the </object>), on the entities.xml, for the space export not related to the target spacekey.

That being said, you can try to modify it and then trying to re-import the space again.
fields.summary: Space export contain multiple spaces

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When moving pages from a space to another, the operation may fail with the following error:
{code:none}The group of pages you're moving contains a page in Draft status that has the same name as a page in the destination space.{code}
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-08 at 09.48.06.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the list of affected drafts in the UI, this way users will know which Drafts/Pages they need to rename or delete in order to finish their move.
fields.summary: Improve error handling when existing Drafts are blocking the Move process between Spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when a free user imports a space into their Confluence site and try to then export it again, it may not be possible.

This happens when the imported space does not have a group or user under its permissions that is common between Confluence sites.

If you are a user in both sites and you also have enough permissions on the exported site on the Confluence of origin, you will be able to export it when it is imported into another Confluence Site.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space in Confluence A
 # Add the desired permissions (make sure that both groups and users are not the same between Confluence Sites)
 # Export it
 # Import the recently exported space into Confluence B
 # Go into Space Settings > Content Tools
 # Try to export the space

h3. Expected Results

The export option is present and active
h3. Actual Results

Permissions carry over from the other Confluence site and the users who imported the space is unable to export it if needed.
h3. Workaround

You can either start the Standard Plan Free trial and then assign the desired permissions for space export or give full access to the space to all site users.
fields.summary: Exporting spaces that have been imported is impossible on the free plan

fields.description:

Pasting tasks that contain a link won't include the link

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add a task to it 
# Add some text, and then, a link
# Copy the task
# Paste it anywhere else in the page

h3. Expected Results
The task is pasted entirely (checkbox, text and link)

h3. Actual Results
The task only pastes partially (not including the link)

!captured.gif! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pasting tasks that contain a link won't include the link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, if the user exports a page containing code snippet macro to Word/PDF, the format including colors and numbered list is not shown correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in Confluence and insert some test and use numbered list
 # Include a code snippet macro and enter some code in it.
 # Tap the 3 dots on the top-right of the page (page tools) and select Export to Word/PDF
 # Open the Word/PDF document

h3. Expected Results

The Word/Pdf document should display the panels and their colors and numbered list correctly
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results

The text inside is displayed in a different format.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior, besides manually re-implementing the color and format in the Word document.
fields.summary: In Confluence, if the user exports a page containing code snippet macro to Word/PDF, the format including colors is not shown correctly.
